project_preview_description.text: A Vehicle Routing Problem simulation using OpenStreetMaps data to find optimal evacuation routes for Glacier National Park in case of emergency.

project_description.text: I produced this paper in February 2019 in response to this problem statement to prepare for a mathematical modeling competition and familiarize myself with combinatorial optimization problems. As shown in the above screenshot, I was able to use real trail data to create an optimally short (minimax) evacuation plan for the entirety of the park using multiple evacuation teams from the different ranger stations in the park.
